model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Classmates A: I can't believe I got caught cheating on my taxes. This is such a mess.

[MEMORY]
User Description: Classmates A is a hardworking individual with big dreams of becoming a professional basketball player. He practices every day, both on his own and with his team, and works on building strength through weight training. Classmates A stays focused on his goal and believes in himself. He recently made a decision to work at the local grocery store to have a job close to home with flexible hours to continue practicing basketball. He balances his job with basketball practice by scheduling shifts around practice time and requesting time off for games or tournaments, showing his dedication to achieving his goals on and off the court.

Relationship Description: Classmates A and Classmates B share a supportive and encouraging relationship. Classmates B understands how Classmates A feels and offers advice and support when needed. Classmates B advises Classmates A to take deep breaths and remember his material, reminding him that hard work will pay off. Classmates B encourages Classmates A to practice more for comfort and offers support, reminding him to ask for help if needed.

Event Description: Classmates A brought goods to Classmates B's house and thanked Classmates B for bringing them over. Classmates A has been keeping busy with work and practicing basketball, saving up money to invest in basketball training. Classmates B appreciated Classmates A's attitude towards pursuing his dream and encouraged him to keep working hard. Classmates A and Classmates B share a positive and motivating bond in their interactions.
